title: Album Page, "Streetscape, Vannes", June 28, 1888
medium: Graphite on thick cream off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 62; bottom right corner: 55; below drawing, center right: Street in Vannes - / June 28th 1888.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a street in town with elevations of medieval buildings along one side of it.  The buildings have three stories, each hanging a little further over the one below, topped by a steeply pitched roof concealing an attic space with dormered windows.  The roof gables are filled in with wood creating a pointed arch that has some depth and shadow behind it.  Each story has floor beams visible, projecting out from beyond the building's walls.  A small commercial space is at street level, its sign on both sides reading "L. Nouil Cirier."  There are two figures walking along side the building, which provides a scale for the building's height.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Streetscape, Vannes", June 28, 1888.Graphite on thick cream off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-228.
